properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms which may be capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots. Frequent lightning and sizeable hail may also be concerns. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-21T05:59:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-20T20:49:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3336507668.2020
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Daytime high temperatures reaching at least 29 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows of 14 degrees Celsius or warmer will continue through the weekend. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T16:44:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T00:45:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2744666219.2020
Area: Ft. Liard Region including Nahanni Butte - Sambaa K'e, Ft. Simpson Region including Jean Marie River, Wrigley Region, Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, North Slave Region including Wekweeti - Whati - Behchoko, Hay River Region including Enterprise, Ft. Resolution Region including Hwy. 6
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A forest fire in the Manicouagan region is currently producing a smoke plume affecting Lac Saint-Jean this evening. These conditions are expected to improve tonight or tomorrow morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-06-21T18:37:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2020-06-21T01:08:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1893325669.2020
Area: Ashuapmushuan Wildlife Reserve area, Normandin - Péribonka area, Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass is streaming into the regions from the south. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached through Monday. Cloud cover will reduce maximum temperatures below warning criteria Tuesday however it is expected to remain humid. Significantly cooler temperatures will arrive Tuesday night. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T17:41:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T01:42:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3934141537.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain this afternoon and early this evening. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T03:59:20-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The heat wave will continue this weekend and into the week. Time span: Sunday and into the new week. Minimum nighttime temperatures: 16 inland with cooler temperatures along the coast. Maximum Temperature Sunday (central and west): 32 degrees Celsius (Humidex 37). Locations: inland areas of Nova Scotia. Remarks: Cooler temperatures will occur along parts of the coast, where winds blow onshore. Temperatures will be much lower over Cape Breton. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Information is provided on the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness website at https://novascotia.ca/heat-related-illness/. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T16:18:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T00:19:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2756149972.2020

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Fog will redevelop this evening and dissipate Sunday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Radar indicates a north to south line of severe thunderstorms 40 km east of Prince George capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The line is moving eastwards at 30 km/h. Communities along Upper Fraser Rd from Newlands to Hansard and Highway 16 will be affected in the next hour. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca.
Expires: 2020-06-21T02:49:09-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. Smoke from a peat fire in the Kamouraska area is causing poor air quality. The poor air quality will persist tonight in nearby areas. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-06-21T17:19:17-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms will continue to develop along a surface trough this afternoon and early evening from Rainbow Lake southeast towards Airdrie. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. Any severe thunderstorms that do develop will weaken this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T02:59:23-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperature: Near zero. Locations: Northern Peninsula East, northeastern, central and southeastern Newfoundland. Time span: Overnight tonight into early Sunday morning. Remarks: While widespread frost is not expected, patchy frost is likely to form, mainly in low lying areas, as mostly clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-06-21T08:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T01:04:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3125623519.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:40 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 55 kilometres southeast of Upper Lawagamau Lake to 35 kilometres south of Upper Lawagamau Lake, moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-21T02:24:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-20T23:41:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3826478031.2020
Area: Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:05 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A severe thunderstorm is located 10 km northwest of Elie and moving northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-21T04:04:31-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. High air pollution is expected this evening and tomorrow due to forest fire smoke. Smoke plumes from forest fires in the Manicouagan area could affect neighbouring areas. Air quality could deteriorate should the smoke go down to ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If your home is not air-conditioned, be sure the house doesn't get too warm when doors and windows are closed to keep out smoke. Exposure to too much heat can also result in illness. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-06-21T16:30:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-21T01:11:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2431620250.2020
Area: Chibougamau, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A warm and increasingly humid airmass is streaming into the regions from the south. Border line heat warning criteria is expected to be reached again on Sunday. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can cause the air quality health index to approach the high risk category. Increased cloud cover will reduce maximum temperatures to below warning criteria for Monday. It will remain humid until a cold front arrives Tuesday. Please refer to your public forecast for further details. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-21T17:40:38-00:00

properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A low pressure system is triggering thunderstorms in southern Manitoba this evening. Some of these thunderstorm may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
